text: In a desert in Iran there is a stone tower, not very tall, without door or window. In the single room (which has a wooden floor and has the shape of a circle) there is a wooden table and a bank. In that circular cell, a man who looks like me writes in a language I don’t understand a long poem about a man who in another circular cell writes a poem about a man who in another circular cell... The process has no end and no one will read what the prisoners write. FIN
title: Un sueño
author: Jorge Luis Borges
